intro: Pilosella bauhini subsp. thaumasia, commonly known as the alpine hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. The plant produces yellow composite flowers with a distinctive, fluffy appearance, and its leaves are typically hairy and lance-shaped. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Pilosella bauhini subsp. thaumasia is adapted to cold climates and is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
